title:
A BGK-type model for multi-component gas mixtures undergoing a
  bimolecular chemical reaction
authors: Giorgio Martal\`o, Ana Jacinta Soares, Romina Travaglini
abstract:
We propose a new kinetic BGK-type model for a mixture of four monatomic
gases, undergoing a bimolecular and reversible chemical reaction. The elastic
and reactive interactions are described separately by distinct relaxation terms
and the mechanical operator is the sum of binary BGK contributions, one for
each pair of interacting species. In this way, our model separately
incorporates the effects of mechanical processes and chemical reactions.
Additionally, it retains the effects of interspecies interactions which are
proper of the mixture. The dependence of Maxwellian attractors on the main
macroscopic fields is explicitly expressed by assuming that the exchange rates
for momentum and energy of mechanical and chemical operators coincide with the
ones of the corresponding Boltzmann terms. Under suitable hypotheses, the
entropy dissipation is proven by means of an H-functional prescribing the
relaxation of the distribution functions to the equilibrium.
